intro: Chamaesyce riebeckii, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its survival in harsh environments.
